Description: One pendant, one amulet and three and a half beads made of different materials. A: One pendant in the shape of a poppy seed, with a flat rear and a textured front, perforation at the top. Well smoothed, made of carnelian. B: Small amulet of a right wedjat eye, made of green faience. Small part in the lower right corner missing. Flat at the base, the front is textured, small perforation along its longitudinal side. C: Two and a half segmented cylindrical bead, one made of a yellow paste (frit?), one and a half made of white faience, one of them flattened. D: One disc-shaped bead made of ostrich eggshell.
Acquisition notes: Formerly housed by the Birmingham Museum and Art Gallery and the EES London.
